Zap special missings to regular R missings

This is useful if you want to convert tagged missing values from SAS or Stata, or user-defined missings from SPSS, to regular R NA.

zap_missing(x)

Arguments

x
A vector or data frame

Examples

x1 <- labelled(
  c(1, 5, tagged_na("a", "b")),
  c(Unknown = tagged_na("a"), Refused = tagged_na("b"))
)
x1
#> <Labelled double>
#> [1]     1     5 NA(a) NA(b)
#> 
#> Labels:
#>  value   label
#>  NA(a) Unknown
#>  NA(b) Refused
#> 
zap_missing(x1)
#> <Labelled double>
#> [1]  1  5 NA NA
#> 

x2 <- labelled_spss(
  c(1, 2, 1, 99),
  c(missing = 99),
  na_value = 99
)
x2
#> <Labelled SPSS double>
#> [1]  1  2  1 99
#> Missing values: 99
#> 
#> Labels:
#>  value   label
#>     99 missing
#> 
zap_missing(x2)
#> <Labelled double>
#> [1]  1  2  1 NA
#> 
#> Labels:
#>  value   label
#>     99 missing
#> 

# You can also apply to data frames
df <- tibble::data_frame(x1, x2, y = 4:1)
df
#> # A tibble: 4 × 3
#>          x1        x2     y
#>   <dbl+lbl> <dbl+lbl> <int>
#> 1         1         1     4
#> 2         5         2     3
#> 3        NA         1     2
#> 4        NA        99     1
#> 
zap_missing(df)
#> # A tibble: 4 × 3
#>          x1        x2     y
#>   <dbl+lbl> <dbl+lbl> <int>
#> 1         1         1     4
#> 2         5         2     3
#> 3        NA         1     2
#> 4        NA        NA     1
#>
